contextId.information: The abstract noun "cleansing" can be expressed as a verb: "making clean." AT: "After he had finished making us clean from sins" or "After he had finished purifying us from our sins" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: After he had made cleansing for sins

contextId.information: Here "death" can be stated as a verb. AT: "by dying" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
This can be reworded so that the abstract noun "confession" is expressed as the verb "confess." AT: "whom we confess" or "in whom we believe" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

Here "courage" and "proud confidence" are abstract and can be stated as verbs. AT: "if we continue to be courageous and joyfully expect God to do what he has promised" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: if we hold fast to our courage and to our proud confidence

contextId.information: Being stubborn is spoken of as being hard or having a hard heart. The hardness is a result of being deceived by sin. This can be reworded so that the abstract noun "deceitfulness" is expressed as the verb "deceive." AT: "no one among you will be deceived by sin and become stubborn" or "you do not sin, deceiving yourselves so that you become stubborn" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: no one among you will be hardened by the deceitfulness of sin

contextId.information: The abstract noun "salvation" can be stated as a verb. AT: "now he saves all who obey him and causes them to live forever" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: became, for everyone who obeys him, the cause of eternal salvation

contextId.information: The abstract noun "salvation" can be stated as a verb. AT: "things that concern God saving you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

A priest's work is spoken of as if it were an object that Jesus possessed. This can be worded avoiding the abstraction. AT: "he is a priest permanently" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

This can be reworded so that the abstract noun "word" is expressed as the verb "swore." AT: "after he had given the law, God swore an oath and appointed his Son" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: the word of the oath, which came after the law, appointed a Son

contextId.information: This can be reworded so that the abstract noun "presence" is expressed as the verb "display" or "present." AT: "bread on display before God" (UDB) or "bread the priests presented to God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

The abstract noun "practice" here refers to a way of atoning for sins. Stopping doing it is spoken of as if it were an object that could be taken away. AT: "stops atoning for sins the first way" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

The abstract noun "offering" can be expressed with the verb "offer" or "sacrifice." AT: "when Jesus Christ offered his body as a sacrifice" or "because Jesus Christ sacrificed his body" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: through the offering of the body of Jesus Christ

contextId.information: This can be reworded so that the abstract noun "forgiveness" is expressed as the verb "forgive." AT: "when God has forgiven these things" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: where there is forgiveness for these

contextId.information: This can be reworded so that the abstract noun "promise" is expressed as the verb "promised." AT: "he lived as a foreigner in the land God had promised to him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: he lived in the land of promise as a foreigner

contextId.information: The abstract noun "faith" can be expressed with the verb believe. Possible meanings are 1) it was by Abraham's faith. AT: "Because Abraham believed God" or 2) it was by Sarah's faith. AT: "Because Sarah believed God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

This can be reworded so that the abstract noun "disgrace" is express as the verb "disrespect." AT: "the experience of people disrespecting him because he did what Christ would want" (See:  [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

The phrase "by resurrection" means "when God raised them from the dead." The word "dead" is a nominal adjective. It can be stated as a verb. AT: "Women received back alive those who had died" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])
contextId.quote: Women received back their dead by resurrection
